observation: Luckily she stopped in time, but almost hit the kitten.
hypothesis: Sally hit the gas when a kitten crossed in front.
Sally's almost could not stop when she pressed her breaks.

observation: Charles still calls the party-line to meet girls.
The girl was a blond supermodel washing cars in a wet t-shirt.
hypothesis: A girl picked up the party line.
He wanted one of them to be his brother.

observation: Tom went to an electronics store to buy earphones.
Tom decided to always buy more expensive ear phones.
hypothesis: Tom bought costly ones but they broke right away.

observation: When I was sixteen I learned to drive.
My dad then took me to get my license.
hypothesis: My Mother taught me all the finer points.
I slept for weeks before my driver's test.

observation: Jim was exhausted from the night before.
When he received his grade the next day, he was surprised to get a B.
hypothesis: Jim took his test after cramming because he was tired.
He was studying all night long.
